Text.Language: Nyo te ]lu,nia~: n~noub ettoub/out: etfai qa pilampac: eymoh n~c/ou niben.
You are the lampstand, made of pure gold, carrying, the ever-burning lamp.

Ete v~ouwini m~pikocmoc: piats~qwnt e~rof: pie~bol qen piouwini: n~ats~qwnt e~rof.
That is the unapproachable, light of the world, that proceeds from, the unapproachable light.

Pinou] n~tav~m/i: e~bolqen ounou] n~tav~m/i: e~taf[icarx n~q/]: qen oumetatsib].
The True God, out of True God, who was incarnate, of you without change.
Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ Ù…Ù† Ø§Ù„Ø¥Ù„Ù‡ Ø§Ù„Ø­Ù‚ Ø§Ù„Ø°Ù‰ ØªØ¬Ø³Ø¯ Ù…Ù†Ùƒ Ø¨ØºÙŠØ± ØªØºÙŠÙŠØ±.
Hiten tefparoucia~: afe~rouwini e~ron: qa n/ethemci qen p~,aki: nem t~q/ibi m~vmou.
By His coming, He gave light to us, we who were sitting in darkness, and in the shadow of death.

Afcouten nen[alauj: e~v~mwit n~te ]hir/n/: hiten ]koinwnia~: n~te nefmuct/rion e#y#u#.
And He guided our feet, in the path of peace, through the communion, of His holy sacraments.

Ucoc niben etqen p~[ici: m~pous~tenywnou e~ro: w~]lu,nia~ n~noub: etfai qa piouwini m~m/i.
All the ranks on high, cannot resemble you, O golden lampstand, that carries the True Light.

Y/ men e~te m~mau: sauyamioc qen ounoub: efcwtp n~kayaroc: sau,ac qen ]c~k/n/.
That was made of, pure and chosen gold, and was placed, in the Tabernacle.

Ceerkebernit/c e~roc: hiten hanjij n~rwmi: eu]neh n~ca neclampac: m~pie~hoou nem pie~jwrh.
That was managed, by the hands of men, who brought oil for its lamps, by day and by night.

V/et,/ qen teneji: Maria ]paryenoc: aferouwini e~rwmi niben: eyn/ou e~pikocmoc.
He who dwelt in your womb, O Virgin Mary, gives light to every man, who comes into the world.

Nyof gar pe v~r/: n~te ]dikeo~cun/: a~remacf aftal[on: e~bol qen nennobi.
For He whom you gave birth to, is the Sun of Righteousness, and He has healed us, of all our sins.

Eybe vai ten[ici: m~mo axiwc: qen hanu~mnologia~: m~p~rov/tikon.
Wherefore we, magnify you befittingly, with prophetic, hymnology.

Je aucaji eyb/]: n~hanh~b/oui~ eutai/out: ]baki e#y#u#: n~te pinis] n~ouro.
For they spoke of you, with great honor, O Holy City, of the Great King.
Ù„Ø£Ù†Ù‡Ù… ØªÙƒÙ„Ù…ÙˆØ§ Ù…Ù† Ø£Ø¬Ù„Ùƒ Ø¨Ø£Ø¹Ù…Ø§Ù„ ÙƒØ±ÙŠÙ…Ø© Ø£ÙŠØªÙ‡Ø§ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø¯ÙŠÙ†Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù‚Ø¯Ø³Ø© Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‰ Ù„Ù„Ù…Ù„Ùƒ Ø§Ù„Ø¹Ø¸ÙŠÙ….
Ten]ho tentwbh: eyrensasni eunai: hiten nep~recbia: n~totf m~pimairwmi.
We entreat and pray, that we may win mercy, through your intercessions, with the Lover of Mankind.
